docs.lead_paragraph: A federally financed study by a committee of mental health experts has urged Governor Cuomo to close some New York State psychiatric hospitals. Local hospitals and community-based mental health centers, they say, should take over the care of the state's chronic mentally ill. The committee said the State Office of Mental Health essentially should only finance, monitor and regulate mental health care and relinquish its day-to-day operation of state psychiatric hospitals to ''responsible agents'' at the community level. ''The Office of Mental Health carries a divided responsibility in New York State,'' the committee said, ''a conflict of interest in that it both administers its own direct services and at the same time monitors, evaluates and licenses its own and the community-based services, and distributes funds to both.''

headline.main: MENTAL CARE SHIFT IS URGED BY PANEL
